channel.title: Rate me site
channel.description:

item.title: Rate me site
item.dc:creator: @3.65_kilos 3.65 kilos
item.description:
@3.65_kilos wrote:

[quote=“fellixombc, post:11, topic:127756”][quote author=3.65 kilos link=topic=178396.msg1636943#msg1636943 date=1185775852]
Why do you have a .login in the CSS but no login id’s (classes)?
[/quote]
?[/quote]
When you use CSS. The CSS would be .SOMETHINGHERE then the HTML you want it to effect would be something like <blahblah class="SOMETHINGHERE>.
You’re selector (.login) is in the CSS, but you don’t have a corresponding class attribute in your code.

Read full topic

item.title: Rate me site
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

3.65 kilos:

Can we see the CSS?

this is the css code:

.progjexGloss { height: 400px; width: 700px; margin-left: 200px; } .login { clear: none; float: right; height: 400px; width: 200px; } .loginyes { clear: none; height: 269px; width: 141px; float: left; } news_body { height: 300px; width: 500px; } newsbody { height: 200px; width: 600px; }

and my web site page code:

[code]

Progjex.com - For all your scripting needs!


News:
Today we just made this template and i and just making up crap for the news to look good and other crap and i am typin fast and is just making no room soo cool hahahahhaha.. i beat most video games is the most more powerful and killing all beasts or monster and this is just crap and stuff and I killed donkey kong and i owned peeps on halo 2 and this is just crap and much more and spanish is cool and omg. dfsk f;sdlafjk ldsk jfkjs d kjgskl gkdgjkgkjlgjk jgkslk;gksfljg fdgh dfgh fasdh adfs hfasd h dasfh adsfh afs hf sdh dfa h adsh asdf h adsgh as gfas dhg dafs ag wer g fdh adsf hfed h afh f h fdh ag sf h f ddsgh dfh ghuh fjfdhfd gh gf hg fd dfgjdsgl kfj dkjsdlk jdsjds kkjds jfs;jkg;

item.title: Rate me site
item.dc:creator: @OnlyOneRule OnlyOneRule
item.description:
@OnlyOneRule wrote:

is the navo meant to be out of place?? ill get print screen on different browsers
ps. try saving the images as a png or gif with alpha trancparancy so you dont see the white corners in the banner and navo images, and set the body borders to 0 so it looks like the banners coming from the top, not just floating in mid air.

css:
[php]body{
margin-top: 0px;
}[/php]

IE6

IE7

Opera 9

FF 1.5.0.12

Safari 2 BETA

Read full topic
